DataElement.preferredName: Patient Receive Local Palliative Radiation Therapy Anatomic Site Within Timepoint Eligibility Determination Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A yes/no indicator that indicates if the patient meets the eligibility requirements for participation in a clinical trial with regards to receiving local palliative radiation therapy to an anatomical site within the timepoint.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Receive Local Palliative Radiation Therapy Anatomic Site Within Timepoint Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._To take, accept, or get something offered._Of or belonging to a restricted area or locality._Any radiation treatment done with the intent to relieve symptoms and reduce the suffering caused by the cancer, and not with the intent of curing the cancer._Named locations of or within the body._On the inside; contained in._A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event._The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:To take, accept, or get something offered.:Any radiation treatment done with the intent to relieve symptoms and reduce the suffering caused by the cancer, and not with the intent of curing the cancer.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
To take, accept, or get something offered.
Any radiation treatment done with the intent to relieve symptoms and reduce the suffering caused by the cancer, and not with the intent of curing the cancer.

Property.preferredName: Anatomic Site Within Timepoint Eligibility Determination
Property.preferredDefinition: Named locations of or within the body.:On the inside; contained in.:A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.:The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

Concepts.definition: Named locations of or within the body.
A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has the patient had palliativ
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had palliative local XRT to any anatomical site within the body in last 4 weeks?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had palliative local XRT to areas other than the chest or whole brain radiotherapy within 13 days from study enrollment?
